job_Description: The Challenge : What if you could use your Ionizing Radiation Exposure background to transform high-risk, high-reward scientific research programs? As an Ionizing Radiation Exposure professional, you understand the power behind complex systems. That knowledge is key when it comes to help shape and guide advanced research programs for the Intelligence Community. We’re looking for expertise in Health Physics/Radiobiology, Biodosimetry, Analytical Proteomics and Lipidomics, and Biomarker Discovery to help Government Program Managers run successful research programs. Our team of scientists provide Systems Engineering and Technical Assistance (SETA) support to programs that have the potential to provide our nation with an overwhelming intelligence advantage. That’s why we need you, an Ionizing Radiation Exposure expert, with expertise in Health Physics/Radiobiology, Biodosimetry, Analytical Proteomics and Lipidomics, and Biomarker Discovery, to help us advise our Government clients work with research partners that come from Academia, other research institutions, and private industry. You’ll work hand in hand with the Government Program Manager to deliver technical support and expertise on new concepts beyond the Program but integral to the Program’s success. We’ll look to you to share your expertise through leadership and mentoring junior staff. Join us and take on exciting challenges in the Intelligence Community. Empower change with us. You Have: 1+ year experience overseeing a multi-disciplinary research and development (R&D) or Test and Evaluation (T&E) team 1+ year of experience with technical evaluation and assessment techniques 1+ year of experience creating program plans, work breakdown structures, and milestone schedules TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph A PhD with at least two years of experience, may include postdoctoral efforts, in Health Physics or Radiobiology with a focus on human exposure, signatures of exposure, and characterizing model systems (OR) A PhD with at least two years of experience, may include postdoctoral efforts, in an Analytical Proteomics, Lipidomics, or other non-DNA focused 'omics field with a focus on Biomarker Discovery. Nice If You Have: 6+ years of experience in Bioinformatics, Mass Spectrometry, Biodosimetry, Machine Learning, Data Analytics, Molecular Biology, Systems Biology, Microbiomes, or Model Systems 4+ years of experience with skin, buccal, microbiome, sweat, or hair model systems 2+ years of experience with characterizing novel biomarkers and signatures 2+ years of experience in the Intelligence Community (IC) or National Nuclear Security Administration (NNSA), including with requirements, CONOPS, and transition 2+ years of experience editing scientific articles, papers, or presentations for a range of audiences 1+ year of experience with animal research, including the IACUC processes, or human subject research, including experience with IRB processes Ability to provide four published first-author peer-reviewed scientific articles OR primary technical holder on two US patent applications, within fields relevant to the technical backgrounds mentioned above Clearance: Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance with polygraph is required. Build Your Career: When you join Booz Allen, you’ll have the opportunity to connect with other professionals doing similar work across multiple markets. You’ll share best practices and work through challenges as you gain experience and mentoring to develop your career. In addition, you will have access to a wealth of training resources through our Engineering & Science University, an online learning portal where you can access more than 5000 tech courses, certifications and books. Build your technical skills through hands-on training on the latest tools and tech from our in-house experts. Pursuing certifications that directly impact your role? You may be able to take advantage of our tuition assistance, on-site courses, vendor relationships, and a network of experts who can give you helpful tips. We’ll help you develop the career you want as you chart your own course for success. We’re an EOE that empowers our people—no matter their race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other protected characteristic—to fearlessly drive change. We’re an EOE that empowers our people—no matter their race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other protected characteristic—to fearlessly drive change. #LI-AH1

Overview:     Pariveda is growing in Washington, D.C. and looking to add an experienced Manager to their team of leaders. We are not your average technology consulting firm. Change is the new normal; we face an increasingly fast-paced, ambiguous, and complex world. Our vision is to be a different kind of consultancy that can be the model for all organizations which seek to position themselves to react more quickly and ready to change. To realize this imperative for ourselves and our clients requires people with a unique blend of skills, competencies, character, and motivations.        Are you ready to work in an environment where you are seen and understood as a whole person? Do you want to stop wondering whether you’re paid and treated equitably? Are you a critical thinker and problem “diagnoser”? Do you have the ability to connect the dots that others don’t see, pulling on threads to get to the true root of the problem? If this is you, join us on our aspirational journey to change the world.        To learn more about our culture and what you can expect at Pariveda, review our Findamentals– the behaviors that show who we are.        You Can Expect To:         Drive your career and become a technology executive through clearly defined expectations, mentorship from Principals and Vice Presidents, and frequent opportunities for advancement      Oversee small teams of Pariveda employees and manage relationships with multiple clients in a variety of industries      Diagnose complex technical and business problems and implement creative solutions that leverage Pariveda’s capabilities to meet our clients’ needs      Use your knowledge of design principles and frameworks to perform and manage all aspects of projects throughout the SDLC including estimation, sprint planning, requirements gathering, architecting, developing, testing, issue/risk management, change control and delivery      Lead the development and delivery of IT solutions across a variety of technologies including: Custom web/mobile development, Cloud Solutions in Azure and AWS, IT Strategy, change & program management, Data Driven solutions, IoT, Machine Learning, CI/CD in DevOps, and more      Deliver presentations and facilitate meetings while adapting communication to varying audiences including high level stakeholders      Identify needs and strengths for career progression of team members and create opportunities for development      Mentor junior colleagues by providing career development goals, meeting regularly, writing and deliver semi-annual reviews, and advocating for their career advancement      Support company growth by building and maintaining a strong professional network as well as contributing to the recruitment of new employees      Actively represent our culture by leading and participating in efforts around continuous learning, personal and professional development, community service and team building           We Look For:     The successful candidate possesses the following critical qualifications:         Passionate technologists with 5+ years of professional experience and a strong foundation in application development      Background in technical and/or management consulting      Demonstrated project management experience - planning, estimation, execution, issue/risk management and resource management/allocation      Experience architecting technical solutions for complex problems and delivering them to technical and non-technical audiences      Experience across all phases of the SDLC and Agile software development practices      Current project leadership of technical teams      Enthusiastic about coaching and mentoring others helping them develop their careers      Ability to become a trusted advisor by building and managing relationships with clients, colleagues, vendors, and other industry professionals      Bachelor’s Degree in MIS, Computer Science, Math, Engineering or comparable experience      Legally authorized to work for any company in the United States without sponsorship           Pariveda Benefits         Transparent and Equitable Salary      Exceptional 401k – 4% company match      Plenty of Paid Time Off - 4 weeks of vacation time plus 10 paid holidays      Paid sabbatical after 5 years of service for Principal levels and above      Paid parental leave      Company Ownership through Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP) from your very first day at Pariveda      Excellent Healthcare and Wellness      100% company paid premiums for you and your family (medical, dental, vision)      Life Insurance      Short Term and Long Term Disability           Pariveda aspires that our employee diversity is representative of the markets in which we serve. Employment decisions are based solely on merit and business needs and not on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, marital status, national origin, citizenship status (if authorized to work in the U.S.), uniform service member, military or veteran status, ancestry, age (over 40), physical or mental disability including HIV or AIDS, medical condition, genetic information, political affiliation, or any other category protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.        #LI-CK1

PhD in economics, finance, quantitative marketing, or related field     Experience in one or more of the following methods: reduced-form causal analysis, experimental design, survey design and implementation, causal machine learning     Experience in one or more of the following research areas: labor economics, personnel economics, education economics, health economics, public economics, behavioral economics     Job summary   The Central Science Team within Amazon’s People Experience and Technology org (PXTCS) uses economics, behavioral science, statistics, and machine learning to proactively identify mechanisms and process improvements which simultaneously improve Amazon and the lives, well-being, and the value of work to Amazonians. We are an interdisciplinary team, which combines the talents of science and engineering to develop and deliver solutions that measurably achieve this goal.      We are looking for an economist with expertise in applying causal inference, experimental design, or causal machine learning techniques to topics in labor, personnel, education, health, public, or behavioral economics. We are particularly interested in candidates with experience applying these skills to strategic problems with significant business and/or social policy impact.      Candidates will work with economists and engineers to estimate and validate their models on large scale data, and will help business partners turn the results of their analysis into policies, programs, and actions that have a major impact on Amazon’s business and its workforce. We are looking for creative thinkers who can combine a strong economic toolbox with a desire to learn from others, and who know how to execute and deliver on big ideas.      Ideal candidates will own key inputs to all stages of research projects, including model development, survey administration, experimental design, and data analysis. They will be customer-centric, working closely with business partners to define key research questions, communicate scientific approaches and findings, listen to and incorporate partner feedback, and deliver successful solutions.            Proven track record in research and solution of business problems leveraging techniques from economics     Advanced coding ability in STATA, R, and/or Python     Effective verbal and written communications skills     Exhibits business judgment     Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

job_title: AMAZON ROBOTICS - Software Development Engineer - Arlington, VA
job_Description: 2+ years of non-internship professional software development experience     Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design     1+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems.     Software Engineer - Team Package Sort        Working at Robotics:    Are you inspired by invention? Is problem-solving through teamwork in your DNA? Do you like the idea of seeing how your work impacts the bigger picture? Answer yes to any of these, and you’ll fit right in here at Robotics. We are a smart team of doers that work passionately to apply cutting-edge advances in robotics and to solve real-world challenges that will transform our customers’ experiences. We invent new improvements every day. We are Robotics, and we will give you the and support you need to invent with us in ways that are rewarding, fulfilling and fun.   As a Engineer on the Robotics Applied Machine Learning Sortation team, you will be part of an exciting, diverse team that is responsible for developing and deploying full-stack using AWS that are scalable, reliable and performant, is obsessed over its customers at its core and its solutions impact thousands of users for every minute of their working day! This team obsesses over human safety and using AI/ML to improve sortation at scale.      You will be part of an inter-disciplinary team comprised of Machine Learning Scientists, Data Scientists and Engineers. The mission of this team is to improve the safety for our associates, optimize sortation algorithms and deliver production quality at scale. You will collaborate cross-functionally to develop pioneering applications in a highly exciting and innovative environment.            Experience developing in Web Services - AWS     Experience with mentoring other engineers     Experience developing cloud services and an understanding of design for scalability, performance and reliability     Self-motivated and able to solve problems independently     Strong communication skills, ability to work well in a team environment     Strong desire to develop skills in Machine Learning and Data Science     is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. EEO Statement: We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. Mercatus complies with federal, state, and university rules as they relate to the COVID-19 pandemic.To be considered for this position you must submit a Resume and Cover Letter. The Data Engineer position at the Mercatus Center will be responsible for the development of Python scripts, custom machine learning algorithms, quality assurance of data pipelines, and the integration of those items into the team’s relational database, API, and AWS infrastructure.  Development and maintenance of Python scripts and Python-based algorithms. Assists with the quality assurance checks for new and existing data, new and existing data pipelines, and the QuantGov API. Stays up to date with best practices in the data science community and consistently applies those best practices to projects. Participates in the SCRUM agile planning framework and contributes to the team’s success through the creation of new projects and leading of projects. Basic Qualifications:  Bachelor’s degree. Minimum 2 years of professional experience developing data applications with either Python or AWS. Familiarity with GIT, PEP8, Docker, virtual machines, and web scraping. Intermediate level experience with Python. Intermediate level experience with NLP, machine learning, and deep learning. Familiarity with AWS configurations and setup. Bonus Qualifications:  Experience with teaching others about machine-learning and natural language processing. Network and application development within AWS. Experience with the development of an API. Experience with Postgres SQL.  Help us Grow   Please submit your cover letter and resume through our online application process. Your cover letter must indicate your interest in the Mercatus Center's mission.   Employee Benefits : Salary is competitive and will be commensurate with experience. In addition, Mercatus provides excellent benefits to all individual employees, including full health and dental coverage, flexible spending accounts, long-term disability and life insurance, a 403(b) retirement savings program, parking/travel benefits, and twelve free credits per year at George Mason University.   About the Mercatus Center at George Mason University : For over 40 years, the Mercatus Center at George Mason University has been the world’s premier university source for market-oriented ideas—bridging the gap between academic ideas and real-world problems. A university-based research center, Mercatus works to advance knowledge about how markets work to improve our lives by training graduate students, conducting research, and applying sound economics to offer solutions to society’s most pressing problems.

Requisition ID: R10034024         Category:  Research and Sciences      Location:  Falls Church, Virginia, United States of America      Citizenship Required:  United States Citizenship      Clearance Type:  None      Telecommute:  Yes- May Consider Full Time Teleworking for this position      Shift:  1st Shift (United States of America)      Travel Required:  Yes, 10% of the Time      Positions Available:  1                At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.     Northrop Grumman is seeking a Senior Principal People Analytics Consultant. This position reports to the Corporate Director, People Analytics, Insights and Technology and will have dotted line reporting responsibility to the Corporate VP of Talent. The person hired into this role can sit in Falls Church, VA and we may also consider full-time remote as well.      People Analytics is a team of data scientists, behavioral research scientists, insight analysts, competitive intelligence analysts, and technologists who use science to inform our most important people decisions and to enable an industry leading employee experience. As a member of the People Analytics team supporting the Talent organization, you will be responsible for leveraging the entire range of our analytics capabilities to refine and enable the enterprise Talent strategy.      In this role, you will be entrepreneurial, creative, and ethically conscious as we work to advance our mission to develop and deliver the insight needed to inform our investments in our employees and design optimal employee experiences. You will be a critical and strategic thinker who helps advance the development, integration, and streamlining of data analysis, reporting, and requests for key Talent work streams, projects, and initiatives. This includes the development of proactive dashboards with key Talent leaders to ensure consistency of measurements of success and program/project performance. You will work closely with the Talent Operations team to build a Talent measurement strategy and framework for all Talent Programs to ensure impact, diversity, and performance. You will support and prioritize all Talent data and insight needs to provide key recommendations and enable key decisions.      Responsibilities:           Consult with Talent leadership to identify top analytic priorities       Streamline reporting and automate where appropriate       Create appropriate dashboards       Develop process for data calls within Talent       Analyze data for trends and next steps       Communicating results to an executive audience to effectively tell the data story       Leverage all available analytics systems and tools (e.g. Workday; People Analytics data warehouse, various analytics dashboards, Talent Neuron, etc.)       Where appropriate, train team members to self-serve customized or ad hoc reporting needs       Demonstrated experience using analytics to inform business decisions       Understanding of HR domain areas, such as recruiting, compensation, performance, learning and development, and HR metrics       Ability to extract and manipulate data from databases using SQL       Ability to use statistical programming languages (e.g., R, Python)       Proficient in data visualization using Tableau or similar visualization tool          Basic Qualifications:           Must have one of the following: Bachelor’s degree with a minimum of 10 years of relevant experience, Master’s degree with a minimum of 8 years of relevant experience, PhD with a minimum of 6 years of relevant experience          Preferred Qualifications:           Strong people leadership skills in an analytics capacity       Ability to communicate effectively to stakeholders across the business       Solid organizational skills, particularly in managing multiple project priorities simultaneously       Expertise in strategy development and business management       Understanding of competitive intelligence / research approaches       Solid statistical understanding and exposure to more advanced analytics, such as machine learning       Knowledge of the aerospace industry       Experience with Workday system                        Salary Range:  $114,300 USD - $171,500 USD                 Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.                   The health and safety of our employees and their families is a top priority. With the continuing impacts of COVID-19 around the world, we are taking action to protect the health and well-being of our colleagues and maintain the safety of the communities where we operate. As a federal contractor, and consistent with Executive Order 14042 (https://www.saferfederalworkforce.gov/contractors/) we require all newly hired employees in the United States to be fully vaccinated by their start date. Federal guidance allows for disability/medical and religious accommodations with respect to the vaccine requirement. Any requested accommodations must be reviewed and approved (if applicable) in advance of your start date.      Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. THE POSITION         This position may be based out of South San Francisco, California, USA, with remote work locations possible in The United States.          The Position  The Genentech Research and Early Development IT group seeks a talented and motivated Platform Engineer to join us in supporting scientific software development. Your responsibilities will focus on building a development platform that supports everything from a code commit to deployment using a variety of tools to automate the process while making it fast and safe. Starting with build automation you will develop processes for storing secrets, managing containers and artifacts, testing code and monitoring continuous delivery among other things. The job will utilize and build on your experience in software development, cloud computing, and automation of a variety of existing and emerging technology and applications. You will join a team of cloud computing and HPC engineers as well as laboratory IT support professionals with technical skills and experience in both technology and life sciences. Together, you will have the opportunity to build a modern software environment to help propel Genentech's drug development ambitions.          The Genentech Research and Early Development organization is a world-class research and drug development organization. Staffed with some of the world's most brilliant scientists, bioinformaticians, and computational researchers, the breadth and depth of scientific expertise across a broad range of disciplines can't be overstated. Encouraging an open, academic-like atmosphere and frequently publishing in top-tier, peer reviewed journals, scientists work with a variety of technologies including high performance computing (HPC), cloud platforms, modern software development tools, petabyte-scale storage, machine learning, and artificial intelligence.          Responsibilities           Collaborate with the business and IT to develop platform patterns and standards       Architect, develop, build, and deploy cloud based software engineering platforms       Automate processes to reduce or eliminate manual steps and improve reproducibility       Accelerate the software development lifecycle by creating build, test, and deploy pipelines       Provide guidance to new and existing development groups on technology adoption       Act as escalation point for incidents, upgrades, and migrations to support operations       Rigorously document solutions and provide knowledge transfer to operational teams       Technically lead and mentor other team members, delegating work, and tracking progress              Qualifications:           8+ years architecting, building, and deploying software development pipelines       Expertise in AWS managed services (EKS, ECS, etc) to accelerate software development       Extensive use of infrastructure automation tools and configuration management a must       Experience with artifact repositories, secrets management & container orchestration tools       Demonstrated experience in software development and application lifecycle management       A focus on solution delivery, with excellent time management and organization skills       Excellent interpersonal skills with your own team, technical IT partners, and customers       Communicate effectively in both written and verbal form to non-technical audiences          RAB-eligible employees  For Colorado-based applicants, the expected salary range for this position is $146,200.00 - $189,200.00. Actual pay will be determined based on experience, qualifications, and other job-related factors permitted by law. A discretionary annual bonus may be available based on individual and Company performance. This position also qualifies for the benefits listed below.      Benefits  Roche offers highly competitive benefit plans and programs, including: •Medical, dental and vision insurance •401(k) and 401(k) matching •Paid time off •Roche Long Term Incentive Plan (available at certain position levels)          #LI-DC2      #gREDinformatics          Genentech is an equal opportunity employer, and we embrace the increasingly diverse world around us. Genentech prohibits unlawful discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin or ancestry, age, disability, marital status and veteran status.          Genentech requires all new hires to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date. This requirement is a condition of employment at Genentech, and it applies regardless of whether the position is located at a Genentech campus or is fully remote. If you are unable to receive the vaccine due to a disability or serious medical condition, or because it is prohibited as a result of your sincerely held religious beliefs, you will have an opportunity to request a reasonable accommodation. job_title: 100% Remote - Sr. Data Analytics Manager -Join a $40B Industry Leader!
job_Description: Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue of approximately $40 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving complex analytical challenges, increasing productivity in their laboratories, improving patient health through diagnostics or the development and manufacture of life-changing therapies, we are here to support them. Our global team of more than 100,000 colleagues delivers an unrivaled combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services, Patheon and PPD.         Position Summary:     The Senior Data Analytics Manager role will support the Analytical Instrument Group (AIG) to use Data Analytics to optimize pricing strategy and drive profitable growth. The role will report to AIG Pricing Director, working within AIG Pricing team to develop and improve pricing tools to empower business to make informed pricing choices. This is a highly visible role in which the talent can unlock significant business potential and facilitate the digital transformation within AIG.     Key Responsibilities:         Lead data analytics capability build and tool development across AIG pricing initiatives, responsible for building and implementing roadmap of sustained pricing analytics capabilities      Lead a team of Data Analysts accountable for delivering high quality and timely insights and models to empower key pricing decisions      Partner with divisions and AIG pricing teams to define and prioritize data needs and develop valuable and practical pricing tools that meet specific business needs      Build reports and dashboards to measure key business performance, including price impact, promotion effectiveness, share gain, customer acquisition/retention, win/loss, etc.      Lead User Acceptance Testing (UAT), user training, and continual enhancements of tools      Lead data collection, integration, transformation, and validation; build robust, efficient, and reliable data pipelines for various data analytics needs      Identify business problems and areas of opportunities and translate business needs into quantitative analyses that enable business to uncover patterns and insights      Collaborate with AIG Nucleus data team to deploy and improve data analytics models, growing data accessibility and quality, facilitating data-driven decision making      Collaborate with Corporate Data Science team to embrace sophisticated machine learning models and experiment data science within the organization        Minimum Requirements/Qualifications:         BS or MS Degree in business, engineering, math, statistics, computer science, or related      7+ years of work experience in data analytics, digital enablement, or related field; prior experience of building and leading teams is strongly preferred      Experience of building tools using data analytics and visualization tools (i.e., SQL, Python, R, Power BI, Tableau, or similar)      Strong problem solving, analytical, and troubleshooting skills      Strong communication skills; ability to articulate complex data models and business problems      Ability to work cross-functionally and effectively influence business partners      Ability to travel (~20%)

Overview:         BigBear.ai  is seeking a     Business Analyst  in Washington,DC/ Remote.    What you will do:        Engage and collaborate with business stakeholders to capture changes to current system processes and document these into system requirement document (SRD) which will require SME sign-off      Collaborate with QA and Development team members to support System release efforts working in an agile environment      Support UAT testing sessions      Develop overview material to be disseminated to internal staff with the deployment of each release      Provide support for special projects as identified by client management      Serve as a production support resource to help identify root cause and provide proper resolution to the Production Support team and/or the System user      Conduct weekly project team meeting for multiple systems      Coordinate and collaborate with other Systems with regards to enhancement integration, testing efforts and other items as defined by the client      Actively work in the client’s CR tracking system, JIRA to ensure that all required documentation is properly maintained     What you need to have:        Minimum of 3 years’ experience documenting requirements and leading requirements analysis sessions with the proven ability to help understand a problem and work with SMEs to identify and capture the proposed solution      Should have the ability to work closely with the COR and be able to form and maintain good working relationships with members of other IT teams, the Project Sponsor, operational management team members and the Bank's business subject matter experts      Demonstrated experience leading system and user acceptance testing including development of end-user training documentation, user stories, and test case scenarios.      Excellent written and oral communication skills.      Excellent listening, presentation, and interpersonal skills.      Should be able to communicate ideas in both technical and user-friendly language.      Ability to think big picture while paying attention and absorbing the details      Demonstrate the ability to identify a problem and work with SMEs to formulate a resolution by offering options, assessing the impact and collaborating to determine the most effective solution      Experience working with the JIRA Software to support agile software development activities     What we'd like you to have:        Keen attention to detail and demonstrates the ability to multi-task      Strong Microsoft Office skills including Word, Excel, Access and Vision                Experience with financial or banking clients         About BigBear.ai:     A leader in decision dominance for more than 20 years, BigBear.ai operationalizes artificial intelligence and machine learning at scale through its end-to-end data analytics platform. The Company uses its proprietary AI/ML technology to support its customers’ decision-making processes and deliver practical solutions that work in complex, realistic and imperfect data environments. BigBear.ai’s composable AI-powered platform solutions work together as often as they stand alone: Observe (data ingestion and conflation), Orient (composable machine learning at scale), and Dominate (visual anticipatory intelligence and optimization).     BigBear.ai’s customers, which include the U.S. Intelligence Community, Department of Defense, the U.S. Federal Government, as well as customers in the commercial sector, rely on BigBear.ai’s high value software products and technology to analyze information, identify and manage risk, and support mission critical decision making. Headquartered in Columbia, Maryland, BigBear.ai has additional locations in Virginia, Massachusetts, Michigan, and California.         BigBear.ai will request COVID-19 vaccination status information as part of the onboarding process.

Data Scientist – Supporting DoD customer onsite :            Basic Position Description:     :     Sealing Technologies is seeking a Data Scientist to analyze the data of a DoD Customer. The Data Scientist will examine which questions need answering and where to find the related data. The ideal candidate is adept at mining large data sets to breakdown data, find trends, as well as generate useful insights. They must have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, building and implementing models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations. They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams.         Work will primarily be performed onsite in Northern Virginia at the DoD customer location.        Position involves the following tasks:        Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.      Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes.      Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy.      Use predictive modeling to identify future occurrences or events of interest.        Required Skills    :         5-7 years of experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models, has a BS/MS in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field.      Strong problem-solving skills.      Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.      Experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, etc.      Knowledge and experience in statistical and data mining techniques: GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining, social network analysis, etc.      Experience working with and creating data architectures.      Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.      Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.      Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.      A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.        Desired Skills    :         Knowledge of DoD processes, procedures, and terminology      Experience with Microsoft Access Database  Experience with ArcGIS        Additional Requirements    :         US Citizenship      Current DoD TS security clearance with ability to obtain an SCI. job_title: Director, Monitoring, Evaluation and Learning (MEL) Climate, Environment & Natural Resources
job_Description: Director, Monitoring, Evaluation and Learning (MEL) Climate, Environment & Natural Resources About Palladium: Palladium is a global company working to design, develop and deliver positive impact on the lives and livelihoods of people around the globe; broaden access to health, water, power, and infrastructure; build enduring, sustainable, and transformative institutions and market systems to address global challenges; and conserve the natural world. We operate in over 90 countries and have a workforce of 3,000 talented, motivated, and diverse staff of all religions, races, languages, and gender identities. Palladium Americas: Our Americas’ business team has brilliant and passionate colleagues working in Asia, Africa, Europe, the Middle East, and North and South America as well as the Caribbean, fulfilling projects and assignments for clients from institutions, corporations, governments, and foundations based in the Americas. We have offices in Washington, DC, New York City, and Raleigh-Durham, NC. This Opportunity: The Director, Monitoring, Evaluation, and Learning (MEL) Climate, Environment & Natural Resources will lead MEL related activities across the company. This position is expected to be 60% business development (working on proposals); 20% thought leadership; and 20% implementation (working on active projects). The ratio of business development to implementation may change over time. Palladium has a commitment to the environment – in how we operate as a company and in the solutions we provide to our clients. Environmental issues like climate change, ecosystem degradation, and resource depletion disproportionately affect the world’s poorest in both rural and urban areas. Only by governing our natural resources effectively can we achieve inclusive, equitable, and sustainable growth and development for everyone. Palladium’s Climate, Environment & Natural Resources Portfolio helps communities share in the wealth of natural resources around them and build resilience to the impacts of climate change, natural disasters and resource conflicts. In the vanguard of the Impact Economy, we’ve pioneered multi-stakeholder approaches in contested sectors such as forestry and mining. Our experts combine technical knowledge with exceptional consultation and negotiation skills across a variety of sectors, including forestry, climate change, land, water resources and extractive industries. Palladium’s Monitoring, Evaluation, Learning and Analytics (MELA) portfolio supports the company in designing equitable and impactful programs, enabling innovation and responsive programming, and demonstrating accountability. Our MELA team uses a variety of methods that support business development and project implementation: root cause analysis; theory-of-change (TOC) development and program design; performance measurement, including data verification and quality improvement; quantitative, qualitative, cost-inclusive, and mixed-methods research methods; collaborating, learning and adapting (CLA) approaches; and modelling and predictive analytics, machine learning and artificial intelligence.   Location:  The position is based in Palladium’s Washington DC office.   You and Your Career:   If you are a problem-solver, collaborator, and doer, and you have expertise in M&E in Climate, Environment & Natural Resources projects, we are interested in hearing from you. We are a learning organization and provide growth opportunities from the start. We pride ourselves on giving you the freedom, resources, and guidance to chart a fulfilling career! Reporting and Supervision: Reports to the MELA Portfolio Lead. This structure will ensure that the support provided to the Climate, Environment & Natural Resources portfolio and other portfolios/business units—including on proposals and projects—aligns with best practices for MEL/CLA development and implementation across the company Primary Duties and Responsibilities: Develop theories of change, results frameworks, activity monitoring, evaluation and learning plans (AMELPs), and key indicators for business development proposals in consultation with the writing team. This includes contributing to the development of indicator targets through research and quantitative modeling with guidance from Climate, Environment & Natural Resources portfolio staff  Develop collaborating, learning, and adapting (CLA) plans that complement the AMELPs and project designs in the business development phase  Proactively identify business development opportunities and capture and/or write proposals Identify key CENR MEL/CLA trends, approaches, methodologies, best practices and lessons learned and apply them to Palladium work  Maintain excellent relationships with clients and implementing partners in the CENR space as well as other sectors to build demand for CENR integration cross sectors  Develop and execute thought leadership strategy for CENR MEL/CLA that includes conferences, publications, blogs and other delivery mechanisms  Advise other portfolios (e.g., health, education, youth, economic growth) and business units on how to integrate CENR related indicators and analyses into their proposals and projects  As the number of Palladium CENR projects increases, report on key performance indicators across CENR projects and facilitate pause and reflect sessions within the company and key communication pieces reflecting on performance  Support MEL development during project start-up, including updates to theories of change (based on proposal submission), AMELP development and submission to client within required timelines  Support the development of project level studies, including the review and/or development of study questions, data collection instruments, analysis, facilitation of ethics review, and leading workshops to interpret/use findings  As needed, support MEL staff in working with project teams on regularly reviewing performance monitoring data to inform adaptive management and project learning  Participate in Palladium meetings and technical excellence and quality groups  Develop a Sharepoint section on MEL/CLA for CENR to be used as a corporate resource  Any other duties as assigned by the MELA portfolio director Key Competencies Required: Experience with successfully identifying and capturing business development opportunities  Demonstrated success in effectively communicating to clients how to deliver results in complex environments  Demonstrated results in execution of MEL/CLA work in CENR type projects  Proven experience in working as a MEL/CLA advisor on USAID funded projects  Ability to develop and implement AMELPs (including CLA) and use inclusive approaches to AMELP design and implementation  Experience working with data analysts, information system developers and others to translate user requirements for data capture/use  Deep understanding of the USAID project cycle, policies, regulations, monitoring and evaluation methodologies, and reporting requirements  Strong strategic thinking, leadership, and people skills with ability to engage a broad range of stakeholders in developing appropriate MEL solutions  Outstanding facilitation skills with a broad range of actors  Familiarity with quantitative and qualitative research and evaluation design and analysis methodologies  High intellectual curiosity and ability to stay up-to-date on latest MEL and CLA approaches  Strong business development and client relationship management skills and sound problem solving and decision-making skills  Strong management, communication, writing, and interpersonal skills  Proactive, self-managing, and self-accountable  Excellent written and verbal communication skills; ability to write technical documents in English  Experience managing and mentoring staff with diverse backgrounds and cultures  Ability to work on multiple tasks, delegate, and adapt to ever changing complexities/conditions  Ability to travel overseas up to 20% time Professional Expertise/Competencies Preferred: Familiarity with CENR data sources and datasets  Familiarity with community lead and capacity strengthening monitoring techniques  Experience with rigorous quantitative analysis (using STATA, SAS, R, Excel or other tools)  Experience analyzing qualitative data using Atlas.ti, NVivo, or other qualitative analysis software  Cross regional experience preferred (e.g., Africa, LAC, Asia Pacific)  Fluency/proficiency in a second language relevant to a developing country context highly desirable  Experience embedding community led monitoring approaches in MEL/CLA work  Experience applying diversity, equity and inclusion principles as part of MEL/CLA work Equity, Diversity & Inclusion  - Palladium is committed to embedding equity, diversity, and inclusion into everything we do. We welcome applications from all sections of society and actively encourage diversity to drive innovation, creativity, success and good practice. We positively welcome and seek to ensure we achieve diversity in our workforce; and that all job applicants and employees receive equal and fair treatment regardless of their background or personal characteristics. These include: (but are not limited to) socio-economic background, age, race, gender identity and expression, religion, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability, nationality, veteran, marital or Indigenous status. Should you require any adjustments or accommodations to be made due to a disability or you are a neurodivergent individual or for any other circumstance, please email our team at accessibility@thepalladiumgroup.com and we will be in touch to discuss. Safeguarding  - We define Safeguarding as “the preventative action taken by Palladium to protect our people, clients and the communities we work with from harm”. We are committed to ensuring that all children and adults who come into contact with Palladium are treated with respect and are free from abuse. All successful candidates will be subject to an enhanced selection process including safeguarding-focused interviews and a rigorous due diligence process.

Proficiency in languages R, Python, or JAVA      Experience with Tableau, Microsoft BI, and SharePoint Develope r      Experience using natural language processing and text mining software to perform meaningful and actionable recommendations from analytical work products to improve business processes      Experience or strong interest in working in a Government, homeland security, and/or law Employees collaborate with clients and partners to create solutions using a human-centered approach.     Our goal is to attract people who love to collaborate and work in a team-oriented environment. Our culture empowers our employees to learn, share knowledge, be leaders in everything they do, and develop strong relationships with their clients and colleagues.     Our positions are based in the DC metro area and require employees to live in DC, VA, and MD within commuting distance of our client sites and DC office.     Commitment to Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Innovation     Arc Aspicio is committed to creating a diverse, inclusive, equitable, and safe workplace and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Description         Job Description:     We are seeking a motivated and talented CV/ML Engineer to join our algorithm development team and participate in software development for advanced real-time detection and computer vision algorithms. You will be involved in the development of computer vision, image processing, machine learning, and deep learning algorithms for our real-time airport personnel and baggage scanning products. You will be working on algorithms for multi-view 2-d and 3-d volumetric detection of prohibited concealed on passengers or in their baggage. We have thousands of scanners in daily operation around the world on which your algorithms will be deployed!        This position has opportunity for telework (up to 100%), but occasional travel to MA will be required.        Primary Responsibilities         Contribute to a team that is developing object detection and image processing system architectures that will be implemented in real-time decision processes in security screening systems fielded across the world      Hands on research and development of advanced deep learning, object detection, image processing, and scene segmentation algorithms      Implement production quality real-time C++ software for sophisticated computer vision and machine learning algorithms; primarily for detecting threat objects in 3-d volumetric x-ray data.      Design and implement new algorithms and improve existing algorithms in C++ and Python class structure using good software engineering techniques with emphasis on reusability and efficiency.      Train machine learning classifiers with emphasis on classifier generalization      Assist with the development of new deep learning algorithms to improve the detection performance for challenging threats      Analyze data, make recommendations, write technical reports      Interface with other software teams to integrate algorithms with external software components.      May require occasional travel (5%), domestic or international, to assist with data collections           Basic Qualifications         BS/MS in computer science/engineering in a related subject such as data science, computer vision, machine learning or AI      3 years image processing experience (filtering, segmentation, edge detection, object detection)      3 years machine learning classifier development experience      2 years C++ software development in a product development environment      Experience designing machine learning algorithms, including creating software for data loading, training, and inference for novel machine learning architectures      Experience with product quality software development including profiling and optimizing real-time algorithm runtime      Must have positive, team focused attitude and approach to work tasks.      Strong math, analytical and communication skills.      Ability to obtain and maintain a US secret security clearance, which requires US Citizenship . We are unable to sponsor visas for this position and require applicants to be either a US citizen or a permanent resident (Green Card holder)           Preferred Qualifications         PhD in computer science/engineering in a related subject such as computer vision, machine learning or AI      2 years experience developing deep learning computer vision algorithms using CNNs, GANs, Transformers, Single and Two-stage detectors      2 years experience with Python      Familiarity with Azure and Git      Strong understanding of statistical pattern recognition and classification.      Basic knowledge of the electromagnetic spectrum (x-ray/radar) and related technologies      Experience with Windows and Linux development environments including writing Perl and shell scripts      Current US secret security clearance           About Us     Our Tewksbury office is a diverse and collaborative environment, only a short commute from downtown Boston and Nashua. We offer flexible work arrangements and support the well-being and mobility of our employees with competitive benefit packages, complementary e-learning training, work-life flexibility, exciting referral programs, and a diverse, inclusive and ethical work place. In fact, in 2021, Leidos was ranked as one of the “World's Most Ethical Companies” by the Ethisphere Institute for the fourth consecutive year.     Driven by our talented workforce, the Security Detection and Automation Operation is the cornerstone of Leidos’ comprehensive suite of fully integrated security detection and automation solutions for aviation, ports and borders, and critical infrastructure customers around the world, with more than 24,000 products deployed across 120 countries. Leidos is positioned to address emerging and evolving threats through rapid development of innovative solutions for our global customers.        sdas        Pay Range:  Pay Range $74,750.00 - $115,000.00 - $155,250.00    #Remote

job_title: Research Scientist in Acoustics and Fluid Dynamics
job_Description: Dynaflow, Inc is currently seeking a candidate with background in two-phase flow dynamics and acoustics to join its full-time technical staff and assist in conducting and procuring research and development projects entailing experimental, analytical, and numerical research and development for applications in acoustic, multi-phase flow, bubble dynamics, and fluid mechanics.      This position entails contributing to further development of Dynaflow's ABS Acoustic Bubble Spectrometer®© , an instrument and software to measure bubble size distributions in liquids and tissue, understanding acoustic wave propagation in bubbly media, and developing analytical, numerical, and experimental measurement techniques. Candidates should have strong interest in understanding physical aspects of problems and experience with data acquisition, signal processing, and machine learning.      Dynaflow, Inc values employees who are creative, dynamic, enjoy team work and are committed to grow with the company.      Graduate and undergraduate degrees in Engineering, Math, Computer Science, or Physical Sciences required. PhD and Masters degrees or equivalent experience preferred.      Dynaflow, Inc is a small high-tech business providing state-of-the art contract R&D and consulting services in fluid mechanics, applied mathematics, and materials science. Dynaflow, Inc. possesses extensive experimental and computational facilities and is engaged in the development of engineering and educational software, scientific instrumentation, and other products.      Dynaflow, Inc is located between Laurel and Columbia, MD, midway between Baltimore and Washington, DC.      Please send resume and qualifications and state your legal status and salary requirements to:    e-mail: info@dynaflow-inc.com   URL: http://www.dynaflow-inc.com      This Position offers comprehensive benefit package, including health, dental and vision. paid vacation and sick leave .  Principals only. No phone calls.  Dynaflow, Inc is an equal opportunity employer.

POSITION SUMMARY   The Senior Conservation Data Scientist (Scientist) leads technology development and data science as part of the Center for Conservation Innovation at Defenders of Wildlife, where we pioneer creative, pragmatic conservation solutions at the intersection of science, technology, and policy. This unique combination of approaches is essential in an age of increasing threats to wildlife and static or dwindling resources for conservation. We identify current and emerging conservation challenges, develop solutions that improve conservation outcomes, and use a suite of techniques and partnerships to advocate for those solutions.   Reporting to the Director, the Scientist plays a key role in CCI by leading a team of developers and data scientists to generate new insights and tools that improve conservation. The incumbent is responsible for analyzing large and complex datasets relating to imperiled species; communicating the results through a variety of creative media; developing novel tools and resources to inform endangered species conservation; managing junior technical and scientific staff developing web-first conservation applications; mentoring and supervising interns; cultivating partnerships with other organizations to implement conservation strategies. The Scientist uses current and emerging data science methods, such as machine learning and computer vision, as well as classical statistical tools. The incumbent will also be Defenders’ lead in applying remotely sensed data, including satellite imagery, to better understand how land use decisions are affecting endangered species. The Scientist must be an ambitious, entrepreneurial, and creative self-starter driven by the opportunity to use empirical research to make smarter decisions about wildlife conservation. Background in endangered species science and policy, especially the U.S. Endangered Species Act (ESA), is mandatory. A minimum of five years of work experience in this area is strongly preferred.   ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES   Primary and essential functions in which the position is the primary owner and driver; should not include functions that are generally delegated to other employees.      Lead the CCI data and technology team.    Manage junior staff, including application developers and data science interns, by providing direction and context guiding the development of public web applications and the Conservationist.io platform.    Ensure that projects and regular job requirements, such as weekly reporting, are completed in a timely fashion.    Ensure direction from Defenders’ leadership, including the Director, is shared with and contextualized for supervisees.    Lead data science to improve wildlife conservation.    Use existing and emerging quantitative and computational methods to analyze data to determine how conservation is carried out and can be improved. Advise the Director on emerging trends in data science.    Serve as Defenders’ lead scientist in the use of remotely sensed data, using data from Landsat and Sentinel 1 and 2 satellites, for example, to monitor species habitat status and compliance with wildlife laws.    Share analysis results to shape outcomes.    Create and publish novel online applications, written products, and other tools to help communicate new findings and advocate for better conservation approaches.    Generate data visualization and exploration products using tools such as R/python, Google and Esri products, and other methods.    Build new partnerships in and outside of Defenders.    Create and manage new partnerships with other organizations to develop and apply innovative, technology-based tools and resources.    Facilitate adoption of CCI work products by partners in order to improve wildlife conservation.    Develop new tools.    Brainstorm and prototype new tools that fill a need in wildlife conservation.    Collaborate with Defenders staff, outside conservation organizations, and federal agencies to identify technical needs and opportunities to develop new methods and approaches to solving conservation challenges.     Perform all other related duties as assigned.   QUALIFICATIONS   Education: Bachelor’s (B.A./B.S.) degree or equivalent   Experience: 8 years of relevant experience; 3 years supervisory experience (if applicable)   An equivalent combination of education and experience may be accepted as a satisfactory substitute for the specific education and experience listed above.   Visit www.defenders.org to apply.   All employees are required to satisfactorily perform the essential duties and responsibilities of their positions. The essential duties and responsibilities listed above are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job. An applicant (i) who is disabled or pregnant or who has a qualifying medical condition that contraindicates a COVID-19 vaccination or (ii) who objects to being vaccinated on the basis of a sincerely held religious belief, observance or practice may request an exemption from this vaccination policy. This determination will be made on a case-by-case basis and in accordance with applicable law. Any medical information concerning an applicant's disability will be treated as a confidential medical record in compliance with applicable federal, state and local laws. Acclaim Technical Services, founded in 2000, is a leading language and intelligence services company supporting a wide range of U.S. Federal agencies. We are an Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP) company, which is uncommon within our business sector. We see this as a significant strength, and it shows: ATS is consistently ranked as a top workplace among DC area firms and continues to grow.     We are actively hiring a  Machine Learning Engineer with TS/SCI clearance and polygraph  with an entrepreneur’s mindset to support a fast-paced and growing data science team working on projects critical to National Security in McLean, Virginia. You will perform network analysis to produce actionable leads in support of CT operations.        RESPONSIBILITIES         The Machine Learning Engineer will work with a cross-functional team of Data Scientists to build state-of-the-art models, automate data pipelines, and develop sustainable data structures for warehousing. The Engineer will engage their soft-skills, communicating complexity to non-technical audiences, mentoring junior teammates, and finding consensus for critical decisions. No two days are alike. The Machine Learning Engineer will react to real-world events to obtain the best possible assessments for the policymakers and warfighters who need them. At the same time, the Engineer will be planning, testing, and building the ML-driven apps which will accelerate the customer’s capabilities.      The Engineer will work in conditions of technical scarcity that often accompany a classified development environment. They will find workarounds and advocate for new approaches while continuing to drive forward. They will step out of your comfort zone. On a given day, the Engineer could brief a simple OLS to a member of Congress or fine-tune the latest transformer model. On some days, the Engineer may do the work of a Software Engineer, a Social Science Statistician, or a Cloud Architect. The Engineer will be trained in our subject matter, which is inherently human-focused and, therefore, messy.      The Machine Learning Engineer who will succeed in this position is a master ML practitioner and an engineer at heart. We are looking for a thought leader with an impulse to experiment and build. Our ideal candidate will be flexible and adaptable, embracing setbacks and changing requirements with humor and expert-level proficiency.      Teamwork and soft skills are critical to success in this position. The ideal candidate will enjoy working as a member of a tight-knit and hierarchically flat team. The Machine Learning Engineer will jump in to help debug a script without asking, and take an hour to walk a junior teammate through the finer points of hyperparameter selection.         REQUIRED EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE         Must possess an active TS/SCI clearance with polygraph      Extensive experience deploying machine learning models into production in a cloud based environment (AWS preferred)      At least 2 years direct experience developing and deploying deep learning models      Expert-level proficiency in at least one scripting language and a desire to code primarily in Python      Extensive experience with the SciPy stack or similar ML framework      Experience with at least one modern deep learning framework (ie TensorFlow, PyTorch)      Experience deploying code in containerized environments using Docker and at least one container orchestration service      Experience designing, developing, and deploying a wide array of data architectures, including data warehouses, data lakes, and standalone relational databases      Must be a resilient problem-solver, adept at finding creative solutions given limited resources and tight deadlines      Typically requires BS degree and 12-15 years of prior relevant experience or Masters with 10-13 years of prior relevant experience.         DESIRED EXPERIENCE            Full stack development experience; including preference for modern java script frameworks such as React, Angular, or Vue      Proficiency working with transformer and LSTM-based NLP models      Technical leadership experience with a track record of quality, on-time deployment      Experience with NoSQL and graph database architectures        COVID-19 Proof of Vaccination Requirements     To protect the health and safety of its employees and to comply with customer requirements, ATS may require employees in certain positions to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or test on a weekly basis. Vaccination requirements will depend on the status of the federal contractor mandate and customer site requirements. Founded in 2005 by supply chain risk management expert Jennifer Bisceglie, we have grown into the largest and most influential player in the emerging operational resilience space. This past July we achieved $100 million dollars in Series C funding led by the investment firm Night Dragon, with additional participation from Series A and B investors Kleiner Perkins and Venrock. This latest round of funding brings Interos' valuation to $1billion, earning us unicorn status.      Based in Arlington, Va., Interos' breakthrough SaaS platform leverages artificial intelligence and machine learning to model the entire business ecosystems of companies into a living global map. Users can drill down to any single supplier, anywhere – helping businesses and government organizations reduce risk, avoid operational disruptions, and achieve dramatically superior resilience and performance. We have seen hypergrowth in the past 3 years and continue to expand our team across the US and several countries in Europe.      The Opportunity:      We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist with an exceptional product sense to help develop data products that give our customers better visibility into their supply chain risk. The ideal candidate should be someone who can explore a new dataset and generate ideas for how to create a visualization, apply a machine learning model, or create a new transformation that unlocks insight for our customers.      Applicants should be familiar with a wide range of machine learning techniques and be able to recognize situations where they can be applied. After using common data mining/analysis tools to demonstrate the power of an ML model or visualization, applicants should be able to clearly communicate its value at different levels of technical detail. Qualified candidates should be focused on results, self-motivated, and have demonstrated success for using analytics to drive the understanding, growth, and success of a product.      The data science team at Interos is dedicated to researching new techniques for communicating supply chain risk to our customers. We anticipate customers' needs, explore open source and proprietary datasets, generate prototype data products, and then drive the integration of successful products into our platform. We collaborate with teams across Product and Engineering to accomplish this.      Essential Functions/duties:          Analyzing large open source and proprietary data sets to identify actionable insights.      Evaluating the effectiveness of different ML approaches to a problem.      Demonstrating new machine learning or visualization capabilities and effectively communicating those across the company.      Guiding new capabilities into production by collaborating with multiple engineering teams.         Minimum Qualifications:          Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or other quantitative field and 8 years of related experience; or 4 years of related experience and a Master's degree; or 2 years of related experience and a PhD.      Strong understanding of data science fundamentals and data analysis techniques.      Knowledge of building, training, and tuning predictive machine learning models.      Fluency in one or more programming languages (Python, R, SQL, etc.)      Self-motivated, collaborative style, open communicator. Comfortable working in a distributed team.         Preferred Qualifications:          Experience with Natural Language Processing (NLP), Time Series Analysis, Knowledge Graphs, Graph Theory, or Network Analysis.      Strong experience in the Python data stack (Jupyter, Pandas, Scikit-Learn, etc.)      A track record of bringing machine learning algorithms to production.         Additional Information:          Supervisory Responsibility: This position has no supervisory responsibilities.      Travel Requirements: This position does not require travel.      Work Environment: This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, printers.      Physical Demands: This is largely a sedentary role. Physical requirements include occasional lifting/carrying of 5 pounds; visual acuity, speech and hearing; hand and eye coordination and manual dexterity necessary to operate a computer keyboard and basic office equipment. Subject to sitting, standing, reaching, walking, twisting, and kneeling to perform the essential functions. Working conditions are primarily inside an office environment.      Colorado Only: The range provided is for Colorado-based hires only and will be commensurate with candidate experience. Pay ranges for candidates in other locations other than CO may differ based on the cost of labor in that location. Pay range: $120,000 - $160,000.      FLSA Status: Exempt         Vaccination Requirement:      Interos is required to comply with  Federal Executive Order 14042  mandating employees be vaccinated against COVID-19. All Interos employees must be fully vaccinated* against COVID-19, unless you have a legally valid medical or religious reason. Any requests for exemptions based on medical or sincerely held religious beliefs will be evaluated confidentially by our Chief People Officer after hiring.         Fully vaccinated means an individual must have received their second dose of the Moderna or Pfizer vaccine or the single dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine. IonQ is developing the world's most powerful full-stack quantum computer based on trapped-ion technology. We are pushing past the limits of classical physics and current supercomputing technology to unlock a new era of computing. Quantum computing has the potential to impact every area of human society for the better. IonQ's computers will soon redefine industries like medicine, materials science, finance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cryptography, and more. IonQ is at the forefront of this technological revolution.   Quantum computing and security are intimately connected. One day, quantum computers will render RSA trivially crackable; today, protecting our cutting edge research is essential. As a Security Engineer, you'll help drive our implementation of security programs like NIST800-53, privacy regimes like GDPR, and even help with SOX. This is an opportunity for a security engineer with an emerging or existing interest in the next generation of computing to bring their diverse background and talents into the future. We'd love a blend of hands-on experience as well as tactical and strategic direction.  In the first three months, you'll be helping roll out the next iteration of our formal security program, while getting us ready for our SOC2 audit later this year.  Responsibilities:   Lead our NIST 800-53 compliance efforts and SOC2 audits  Improve the security and privacy of our cloud infrastructure and facilities  Perform risk assessments and internal auditing  Continuously improve our application security posture  Prepare teams across the company through exercises, training, and collaboration  Collaborate with both technical and non-technical teams, from legal, to engineering, to finance, to operations, to supply chain  Develop and document processes supporting secure operations  Plan and lead cross functional security projects including tool implementations  Assist with responding to incidents as they arise   The ideal candidate will have experience leading or contributing to multiple simultaneous initiatives, balancing multiple activities with a keen eye for prioritizing for the biggest impact. You'll be able to balance technical expertise and savvy with strong business judgment to make great technology choices with lasting impact. You'll strive for simplicity and demonstrate significant creativity and incisive judgment. You'll enjoy learning technical topics, working across multiple business streams, and be uniquely positioned to help us reach the next horizon in secure quantum computing.  You'd be a good fit with:   Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience - untraditional backgrounds are welcome and encouraged!  Familiarity with NIST800-53 and other infosec frameworks  Technical experience in systems administration, software engineering, digital forensics, security engineering and/or privacy engineering  Background in security risk management and analysis  Excitement to learn and get things done right  Empathy for your internal and external customers and excellent communication skills, since you'll be working with folks of all backgrounds - technical and non-technical alike!   You'd be a great fit with:   Masters or PhD degree in security or related  Proven ability to lead security initiatives  Prior experience with SOC2 audits  Prior experience with application security  3+ years of experience with incident or emergency response coordination  Our HQ is located in College Park, Maryland and we are a 15 minute metro ride from Washington DC. We are actively building out teams in the Washington D.C., Seattle, and Boston metro areas and will want to locate you in one of these geographies. However, IonQ will be expanding into additional geographies both domestically and internationally so don't let this stop you from applying.  At IonQ, we believe in fair treatment, access, opportunity and advancement for all, while at the same time striving to identify and eliminate barriers. We empower employees to thrive by fostering a culture of autonomy, productivity, and respect. We are dedicated to creating an environment in which any individual can feel welcomed, respected, supported and valued.  We are committed to equity and justice. We welcome different voices and viewpoints and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, physical and/or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, age, sexual orientation, and military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by law. We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer.  If you are interested in being a part of this team and mission, we encourage you to apply.

• B.S. degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science or a similar quantitative field • 3+ years work experience in relevant field • Experience in using SQL to analyze data in a database or data warehouse and be able to use a major programming (e.g. Java/C) and/or a scripting language (Perl, Unix shell) to process data for modeling • Experience working with a wide range of predictive and decision models and data mining techniques, as well as tools for developing such models        Job summary    The Marketing Intelligence team within AWS is responsible for setting the AI/ML strategy and delivering machine learning services transforming MarTech and AdTech to AWS customers.
